snippet: A former nurse convicted of killing five dialysis patients by injecting them with bleach should spend the rest of her life in prison with no chance of parole, jurors said Monday.
abstract: Kimberly Saenz, a former nurse convicted of killing five dialysis patients in Texas by injecting them with bleach, is sentenced to life imprisonment with no chance of parole.
lead_paragraph: A former nurse convicted of killing five dialysis patients by injecting them with bleach should spend the rest of her life in prison with no chance of parole, jurors said Monday.

headline.main: Texas: Nurse Spared Execution in Bleach Deaths
headline.print_headline: Texas: Nurse Spared Execution In Bleach Deaths
